type.name: org.gradle.api.tasks.javadoc.Groovydoc
type.description:
Generates HTML API documentation for Groovy source, and optionally, Java source.

This task uses Groovy's Groovydoc tool to generate the API documentation. Please note that the Groovydoc tool has some limitations at the moment. The version of the Groovydoc that is used, is the one from the Groovy dependency defined in the build script.

method.name: getClasspath
method.description:
Returns the classpath used to locate classes referenced by the documented sources.

returns:The classpath used to locate classes referenced by the documented sources

method.name: getDestinationDir
method.description:
Returns the directory to generate the documentation into.

returns:The directory to generate the documentation into

method.name: getDocTitle
method.description: Returns the title for the package index(first) page. Set to null when there is no document title.

method.name: getFooter
method.description: Returns the HTML footer for each page. Set to null when there is no footer.

method.name: getGroovyClasspath
method.description:
Returns the classpath containing the Groovy library to be used.

returns:The classpath containing the Groovy library to be used

method.name: getHeader
method.description: Returns the HTML header for each page. Set to null when there is no header.

method.name: getLinks
method.description: Returns the links to groovydoc/javadoc output at the given URL.

method.name: getOverviewText
method.description: Returns a HTML text to be used for overview documentation. Set to null when there is no overview text.

method.name: getWindowTitle
method.description: Returns the browser window title for the documentation. Set to null when there is no window title.

method.name: isIncludePrivate
method.description: Returns whether to include all classes and members (i.e. including private ones).

method.name: isNoTimestamp
method.description: Returns whether to include timestamp within hidden comment in generated HTML (Groovy >= 2.4.6).

method.name: isNoVersionStamp
method.description: Returns whether to include version stamp within hidden comment in generated HTML (Groovy >= 2.4.6).

method.name: isUse
method.description: Returns whether to create class and package usage pages.

method.name: link
method.description:
Add links to groovydoc/javadoc output at the given URL.
param:url Base URL of external site
param:packages list of package prefixes

method.name: setClasspath
method.description: Sets the classpath used to locate classes referenced by the documented sources.

method.name: setDestinationDir
method.description: Sets the directory to generate the documentation into.

method.name: setDocTitle
method.description:
Sets title for the package index(first) page (optional).
param:docTitle the docTitle as HTML

method.name: setFooter
method.description:
Sets footer text for each page (optional).
param:footer the footer as HTML

method.name: setGroovyClasspath
method.description: Sets the classpath containing the Groovy library to be used.

method.name: setHeader
method.description:
Sets header text for each page (optional).
param:header the header as HTML

method.name: setIncludePrivate
method.description: Sets whether to include all classes and members (i.e. including private ones) if set to true.

method.name: setLinks
method.description:
Sets links to groovydoc/javadoc output at the given URL.
param:links The links to set (see String...))

method.name: setNoTimestamp
method.description: Sets whether to include timestamp within hidden comment in generated HTML (Groovy >= 2.4.6).

method.name: setNoVersionStamp
method.description: Sets whether to include version stamp within hidden comment in generated HTML (Groovy >= 2.4.6).

method.name: setOverviewText
method.description:
Sets a HTML text to be used for overview documentation (optional).

Example: overviewText = resources.text.fromFile("/overview.html")

method.name: setUse
method.description: Sets whether to create class and package usage pages.

method.name: setWindowTitle
method.description:
Sets the browser window title for the documentation.
param:windowTitle A text for the windows title

property.name: classpath
property.description:
Returns the classpath used to locate classes referenced by the documented sources.

returns:The classpath used to locate classes referenced by the documented sources

property.name: destinationDir
property.description:
Returns the directory to generate the documentation into.

returns:The directory to generate the documentation into

property.name: docTitle
property.description: Returns the title for the package index(first) page. Set to null when there is no document title.

property.name: footer
property.description: Returns the HTML footer for each page. Set to null when there is no footer.

property.name: groovyClasspath
property.description:
Returns the classpath containing the Groovy library to be used.

returns:The classpath containing the Groovy library to be used

property.name: header
property.description: Returns the HTML header for each page. Set to null when there is no header.

property.name: includePrivate
property.description: Returns whether to include all classes and members (i.e. including private ones).

property.name: links
property.description: Returns the links to groovydoc/javadoc output at the given URL.

property.name: noTimestamp
property.description: Returns whether to include timestamp within hidden comment in generated HTML (Groovy >= 2.4.6).

property.name: noVersionStamp
property.description: Returns whether to include version stamp within hidden comment in generated HTML (Groovy >= 2.4.6).

property.name: overviewText
property.description: Returns a HTML text to be used for overview documentation. Set to null when there is no overview text.

property.name: use
property.description: Returns whether to create class and package usage pages.

property.name: windowTitle
property.description: Returns the browser window title for the documentation. Set to null when there is no window title.
